availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James L. Warren (Bath County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer. Married to Elizabeth Warren in Bath County in 1831. Father of Wilkins Warren, Mary Warren, Elizabeth Warren, Benjamin F. Warren, Miranda Warren, James Warren, John Warren, and Jessie A. Warren. Farmer in Bath County in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Bath County in 1850. Farmer in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath, Division 2, p. 19B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath, Division 2, p. 304.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath, not stated, p. 127.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath, Polksville, p. 311A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages, Film #000273004, p. 690 of 848 on Microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, “James L. Warren (1810-1880),” Memorial #97918102, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/97918102 (accessed June 5, 2017).
